intro: Maihueniopsis leoncito, commonly known as the Andean leoncito, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh alpine conditions, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. It typically grows in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
